tool.name: Copy_tracmap_data_to_geodatabase

param.name: data_source_location
param.displayname: Drive or folder containing the Tracmap data to copy
param.dialogReference:
The location of the Tracmap data, being a folder or a drive i.e. E:\ drive. The whole directory including subdirectories will be copied to the folder specified below, as is with no alterations.

If the source log & secondary shapefiles are in a folder called "Block" then the tool should be pointed to the parent folder of "Block" often the name of the site eg tracmap/site/block/log.shp

If the source shapefiles are in helicopter/time or vice versa format then again select the second lowest folder eg "Helicopter" in this structure: Site/time/helicopter/block

If the lowest folder contains more than one shapefile the tool will process them all.

param.name: coordinate_system
param.dialogReference:
This should generally be WGS_84 datum, though some operators use NZTM 2000

This is the coordinate system that the source files are provided in. (The tool will project the processed data into NZTM)

param.name: parent_directory
param.displayname: Parent directory where the raw Tracmap data will be stored
param.dialogReference: The location where all the raw shapefiles from the helicopter are stored. Each helicopter has its own directory and within this directory, there are directories which hold all of the data from a particular download.

param.name: treatment_area_fc
param.displayname: Feature class containing the treatment area blocks
param.dialogReference:
This is optional.

If this information is provided then the tool can be used to calculate percentage complete. In this case the treatment area file must have a field name called HeliBlkNm with unique block names matching those being used by the helicopters as well as a Hectares attribute.

param.name: in_workspace
param.displayname: File geodatabase where the processed data from the helicopter will be stored
param.dialogReference: The geodatabase where the data from all the helicopters will be collated.

param.name: file_geodatabase_location
param.displayname: Location of the new file geodatabase

param.name: file_geodatabase_name
param.displayname: Name of the new file geodatabase
param.dialogReference: The geodatabase created will contain the feature classes total_lines, total_points, total_polygons, flight_path and the table sum_totals

param.name: helicopter_reg_no
param.dialogReference:
THIS IS NOT OPTIONAL!

This is the identifier written on the side of the helicopter.It is usually 2 or 3 letters such as ABC or XY. If it is only 2 letters, standard practice is to prefix H to it, so XY becomes HXY.

param.name: download_time
param.dialogReference:
Enter the time the download from the helicopter is processed. This is in the format 1234, being 12.34 pm. It must only be 4 characters.

This time must be unique per helicopter.

param.name: write_to_parameters_file
param.displayname: Set up and write parameters to D:\TestThursday\Tracmap_UtilitiesGary\parameters.csv. No flight data will be processed. Refresh toolbox!
param.dialogReference:
No Tracmap data will be processed. Use this to update the parameters for:

'Drive or folder containing the Tracmap data to copy'

'Coordinate system of Tracmap data'

'Parent directory where the raw Tracmap data will be stored'

'File geodatebase where the process data from the helicopter will be stored'

Refresh the tool box to see the updated the parameters.

param.name: create_dissolved_polygons
param.displayname: Dissolve polygons (by block and total) in Processed6.gdb and output a summary csv file in D:\TestThursday
param.dialogReference:
Dissolve the total_polygons feature class in the file geodatabase shown in 'File geodatabase where the processed data from the helicopter will be stored'. Any entries shown in the other inputs will be ignored.

The data is dissolved both by block name and by the whole treatment area and this data will be used in the summary csv file to show the dissolved area of each block. However if there aren't block names available in the data, a total dissolve only will take place.

param.name: deflector_chkbox
param.displayname: Deflector bucket in use - this bucket spreads bait to the right side only

tool.summary:
This tool facilitates copying Tracmap data from a usb drive to the pc. All the data contained on the usb drive is copied to a user specified parent directory on the pc.The sow lines are then appended to a line feature class in a user specified geodatabase. The lines are then buffered to a polygon feature class within the geodatabase based on the widthcontained in the tracmap shapefile.

The secondary shapefile contains the route the helicopter flew when it wasn't spreading bait. This data is first copied to a points feature class, which is then used to produce a line shapefile.

The secondary shapefile contains the route the helicopter flew when it wasn't spreading bait. This data is first copied to a points feature class, which is then used to produce a line shapefile.
